org.stripesstuff.stripersist
Class Dao

java.lang.Object
  org.stripesstuff.stripersist.Dao

public class Dao
extends Object

Stripersist's Dao provides a simple generified static DAO. It is not intended to perform magic. It simply makes JPA a little easier to deal with. By providing generified methods it allows you to avoid some casting. It also makes Query a little easier to deal with.

Because this class is static it is not possible to subclass it. For any advanced features that you want to add you'll have to copy the source and create a new class. Sorry!

Special thanks to Freddy Daoud and his wonderful book on Stripes which inspired me to start using DAOs.

Author:
Aaron Porter

Method Detail

find

public static <T,K> T find(Class<T> type,
                           K key)
Generic version of JPA's find.

Type Parameters:
T - the type you're looking for
K - the type of the primary key
Parameters:
type - the type you're looking for
key - the primary key
Returns:
the entity with type and primary key specified

persist

public static <T> T persist(T entity)
Store a new entity in the database. If you're trying to persist an object that already has a primary key it is assumed that the object is already in the database so it isn't necessary (and will cause errors) if we try to persist it again.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the entity
Parameters:
entity - the entity to persist
Returns:
the entity that was persisted

A shortcut to Stripersist.getEntityManager().getTransaction().begin()

createQuery

public static Query createQuery(String jqpl)
A shortcut to Stripersist.getEntityManager().createQuery(query)

Parameters:
jqpl - a JPQL query
Returns:
a JPA Query object

list

public static <T> List<T> list(String jpql,
                               Object... params)
Search the database for a list of entities matching the given query. The magic of generics allows us to return the type that you're expecting so you don't have to cast it. Of course there will be problems if the type the query returns doesn't match what you're trying to assign it to.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of entity to search for
Parameters:
jpql - a JPQL query
params - parameters for the JPQL query
Returns:
a list of the entities found

find

public static <T> T find(String jpql,
                         Object... params)
Search the database for a unique entity that matches the given query. The magic of generics allows us to return the type that you're expecting so you don't have to cast it. Of course there will be problems if the type the query returns doesn't match what you're trying to assign it to.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of entity to search for
Parameters:
jpql - a JPQL query
params - parameters for the JPQL query
Returns:
the unique entity that matched the query or null

first

public static <T> T first(String jpql,
                          Object... params)
Search the database for a list of entities matching the given query and return the first element of the list. The magic of generics allows us to return the type that you're expecting so you don't have to cast it. Of course there will be problems if the type the query returns doesn't match what you're trying to assign it to.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of entity to search for
Parameters:
jpql - a JPQL query
params - parameters for the JPQL query
Returns:
the first element in the list or null
